Revised ATM Transaction Rules:

Charges:After May 1, 2025, exceeding the monthly free transaction limit at ATMs will incur a charge of up to ₹23 per transaction (up from ₹21).

Free Transactions:

Customers will still receive 5 free transactions per month at their own bank ATMs.

Free transactions at other bank ATMs are limited to 3 per month in metro centers and 5 per month in non-metro centers.

OTP for Withdrawals:Withdrawals above ₹5,000 may require OTP-based verification for added security.

Cardless Withdrawals:All banks, including Union Bank, are mandated to offer cardless cash withdrawals using UPI platforms across their ATMs.

RBI's PRAVAAH Portal:Union Bank, like other regulated entities, is required to submit applications for regulatory authorizations, licenses, and approvals through the RBI's PRAVAAH portal starting May 1, 2025.

Digital Lending Rules:The RBI has introduced new digital lending guidelines that Union Bank will need to comply with, focusing on customer protection and transparency.

Other Potential Impacts:Changes in savings account and Fixed Deposit (FD) interest rates by some banks also came into effect on May 1, 2025, which may influence Union Bank's offerings.
